intro: Eriogonum clutei, commonly known as Clute's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and open woodlands. It produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. Eriogonum clutei is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with low precipitation.
